issue.title: Allow unmigrated records to be updated without migrating them to the new registry.
issue.body:
Some users are in a position where they cannot or should not migrate their names - particularly subdomains - to the new registry, but still need to update them. For example, tokencard have deployed wallets that have the old registry address hardcoded, which they use to look up blacklists, whitelists, and upgradeable contract addresses.

When someone wants to set the resolver or owner on a record that is not in the new registry, we should allow this by sending the transaction to the old registry address. We should also allow editing records on old resolvers if the name is not migrated.

issue.title: Use subgraph to display coinType
issue.body:
This will eliminates the need to loop all coinTypes 
Pending PR is https://github.com/ensdomains/ens-app/pull/517

issue.title: Allow user to type any type of text record
issue.body:
Currently users can only add several known fields.
Add and display any keys.

Needs to be for multicoin and text records. This also needs to be added to the resolver migration check

NOTE: This probably needs a bit of design consideration for UI to allow users to type any keys.

issue.title: Setting a resolver is confusing
issue.body:
When you try to set a resolver, it shows you a field that says "Enter Ethereum name or address." This is confusing because people could think they're supposed to put their own Ethereum address there. Also, 99.999% of people are going to use the Public Resolver, so it shouldn't be a small link under the field.

I would at least change the text to say something more like "Enter contract address of custom resolver or use Public Resolver".

And really, it should just default to the Public Resolver anyway, with setting a custom resolver being an "Advanced Option" or something.

issue.title: Handle migrating resolvers with unsupported records more gracefully
issue.body:
At present, if someone tries to migrate a resolver with a record we don't understand - such as a contenthash record we don't know how to decode - we throw a JS error.

Two things to fix here:
 - We don't need to decode contenthash records in order to migrate them, we can just copy them over without understanding them.
 - If we encounter an error trying to migrate a record, we should catch it, explain we can't migrate that record, and offer to migrate the rest.

issue.title: Display thumbnail of avatar listed in text records
issue.body: Would be great to display a thumbnail (e.g. could be 300px x 300px or something similar), directly under the avatar text record field. This makes the avatar text record field more "real" in the Manager.

rename.to: Text record URL record should be clickable

issue.title: Text record URL record should be clickable
issue.body: @jefflau: As discussed with @Arachnid, we'd like to make the presentation of URL's a bit more prominent and, most importantly, clickable. OpenSea is using this as a way to link people to the sale for the domain, and it currently is pretty difficult for users to discover how to get there.

issue.title: Drop down menu for choosing Content record type prefix
issue.body:
Rather than having users type in "onion://" or "ipfs://" et al, with the options as suggested text in the text field, those prefixes should be able to be chosen from a dropdown menu (similar to text record keys), and then the user only puts the hash in the field.

This would make it simpler for users, and make it easier for us to add other Content record types in the future (e.g. ZeroNet).

issue.title: Replace Migration warning banner on app homepage with new link
issue.body:
New banner could read something like:
"ENS Registry Post-Migration: Important Things to Know"

And link to this:
https://medium.com/the-ethereum-name-service/ens-registry-migration-is-over-now-what-a-few-things-to-know-fb05f921872a

rename.to: [WIP] Add Temporal support to Manager (IPFS file uploads)

issue.title: [WIP] Add Temporal support to Manager (IPFS file uploads)
issue.body:
This PR:

- adds support to upload a file or directory to IPFS directly from the ENS app
- adds docker support for deploying

This adds an additional icon/button to the `Records Item (src/components/SingleName/ResolverAndRecords/RecordsItem.js )` component that when clicked allows the user to log in to a provider and then upload files to IPFS. Right now the only provider is [Temporal](temporal.cloud) but any provider who supports an [IPFS](https://docs.ipfs.io/reference/api/http/) can easily be added. 

Currently we are having a problem saving the login token to local storage. The problem likely stems from lines 109-110 in `src/components/IPFS/Login.js`. It is getting called but it isn't setting the token. We have tried also setting the token with `JSON.stringify()` but that didn't seem to make difference either.

I can be reached through github or on discord dc#8876

You can see this PR deployed at https://ens-app.temporal.cloud

issue.title: [WIP] Add Temporal support to Manager (IPFS file uploads)
issue.body:
This PR:

- adds support to upload a file or directory to IPFS directly from the ENS app
- adds docker support for deploying

This adds an additional icon/button to the `Records Item (src/components/SingleName/ResolverAndRecords/RecordsItem.js )` component that when clicked allows the user to log in to a provider and then upload files to IPFS. Right now the only provider is [Temporal](temporal.cloud) but any provider who supports an [IPFS](https://docs.ipfs.io/reference/api/http/) can easily be added. 

Currently we are having a problem saving the login token to local storage. The problem likely stems from lines 109-110 in `src/components/IPFS/Login.js`. It is getting called but it isn't setting the token. We have tried also setting the token with `JSON.stringify()` but that didn't seem to make difference either.

I can be reached through github or on discord dc#8876

You can see this PR deployed at https://ens-app.temporal.cloud

issue.title: Non-supported TLD warning needs fixing
issue.body: The first message should read: ""KRED" is not currently a supported TLD." The second message should read: "We currently only support .ETH and .XYZ names. Support for future domains is planned for the future." Lastly, ENS actually does support other TLDs, namely .LUXE, .ART, .KRED, and .CLUB, and those also needed to be added to be supported in our Manager.

issue.title: [BUG] - DapperWallet-ENS
issue.body:
Alright! Hello!
So I am currently using the Dapper Extension on my brave browser on a Windows HP. I have tried to purchase an ENS name using Dapper. After I click the 'Register' button, I am prompted to my Dapper wallet to send the transaction, and I am able to send the first transaction. However, after the first transaction is sent and confirmed, nothing happens within the ENS app, it doesn't move forward in the process of then prompting me for the second transaction. 

**Basically I am stuck in the loop of sending the first transaction over and over, but not being able to move forward in the process.** I also tried the same in my Google Chrome browser to see if it wasn't Brave the one giving me issues. However, I had the same problem of being stuck in the loop of sending the first transaction. I have attached some screenshots below. Basically the process does not start/move forward after the first transaction is sent.

### Grateful for the work you guys put in!
Best,

![Dapper1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32444279/68087550-c6d68e00-fe1c-11e9-9464-f88bd0678234.PNG)
![Dapper2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32444279/68087551-c6d68e00-fe1c-11e9-9ebb-9bcbdbff3e09.PNG)
![Dapper3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32444279/68087552-c76f2480-fe1c-11e9-9aab-97c85a700391.PNG)
![Dapper4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32444279/68087553-c76f2480-fe1c-11e9-8644-7690d624046a.PNG)

issue.title: UI display problems in Manager on mobile
issue.body:
See pictures. I've put red marks near problem areas. Getting mobile looking and working right is really important since many mobile wallets like TrustWallet are adopting ENS and sending users to our Manager in their mobile app to register and manage their ENS name.

Both screenshots are in Brave on my Android phone. One is on the page for brantly.eth, the other on the page for brantly.xyz.

![brantly eth record](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30162762/68732403-1c7f0900-0588-11ea-8fb1-b00468f7d85a.jpg)
